connector.description: Configure REST producers based on an OpenAPI specification document delegating to a component implementing the RestProducerFactory interface.

camel.sink.path.specificationUri.name: camel.sink.path.specificationUri
camel.sink.path.specificationUri.description: Path to the OpenApi specification file. The scheme, host base path are taken from this specification, but these can be overridden with properties on the component or endpoint level. If not given the component tries to load openapi.json resource from the classpath. Note that the host defined on the component and endpoint of this Component should contain the scheme, hostname and optionally the port in the URI syntax (i.e. http://api.example.com:8080). Overrides component configuration. The OpenApi specification can be loaded from different sources by prefixing with file: classpath: http: https:. Support for https is limited to using the JDK installed UrlHandler, and as such it can be cumbersome to setup TLS/SSL certificates for https (such as setting a number of javax.net.ssl JVM system properties). How to do that consult the JDK documentation for UrlHandler. Default value notice: By default loads openapi.json file

camel.sink.path.operationId.name: camel.sink.path.operationId
camel.sink.path.operationId.description: ID of the operation from the OpenApi specification.

camel.sink.endpoint.basePath.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basePath
camel.sink.endpoint.basePath.description: API basePath, for example /v2. Default is unset, if set overrides the value present in OpenApi specification and in the component configuration.

camel.sink.endpoint.componentName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.componentName
camel.sink.endpoint.componentName.description: Name of the Camel component that will perform the requests. The component must be present in Camel registry and it must implement RestProducerFactory service provider interface. If not set CLASSPATH is searched for single component that implements RestProducerFactory SPI. Overrides component configuration.

camel.sink.endpoint.consumes.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumes
camel.sink.endpoint.consumes.description: What payload type this component capable of consuming. Could be one type, like application/json or multiple types as application/json, application/xml; q=0.5 according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Accept HTTP header. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification and. in the component configuration

camel.sink.endpoint.host.name: camel.sink.endpoint.host
camel.sink.endpoint.host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint, component or in the corresponding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first, rest-openapi next, and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification, RestConfiguration. Overrides all other configuration.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.produces.name: camel.sink.endpoint.produces
camel.sink.endpoint.produces.description: What payload type this component is producing. For example application/json according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Content-Type HTTP header. If set overrides any value present in the OpenApi specification. Overrides all other configuration.

camel.component.rest-openapi.basePath.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.basePath
camel.component.rest-openapi.basePath.description: API basePath, for example /v2. Default is unset, if set overrides the value present in OpenApi specification.

camel.component.rest-openapi.componentNa.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.componentName
camel.component.rest-openapi.componentNa.description: Name of the Camel component that will perform the requests. The component must be present in Camel registry and it must implement RestProducerFactory service provider interface. If not set CLASSPATH is searched for single component that implements RestProducerFactory SPI. Can be overridden in endpoint configuration.

camel.component.rest-openapi.consumes.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.consumes
camel.component.rest-openapi.consumes.description: What payload type this component capable of consuming. Could be one type, like application/json or multiple types as application/json, application/xml; q=0.5 according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Accept HTTP header. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification. Can be overridden in endpoint configuration

camel.component.rest-openapi.host.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.host
camel.component.rest-openapi.host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint, component or in the corresponding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first, rest-openapi next, and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification, RestConfiguration. Can be overridden in endpoint configuration.

camel.component.rest-openapi.lazyStartPr.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.rest-openapi.lazyStartPr.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.rest-openapi.produces.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.produces
camel.component.rest-openapi.produces.description: What payload type this component is producing. For example application/json according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Content-Type HTTP header. If set overrides any value present in the OpenApi specification. Can be overridden in endpoint configuration.

camel.component.rest-openapi.specificati.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.specificationUri
camel.component.rest-openapi.specificati.description: Path to the OpenApi specification file. The scheme, host base path are taken from this specification, but these can be overridden with properties on the component or endpoint level. If not given the component tries to load openapi.json resource. Note that the host defined on the component and endpoint of this Component should contain the scheme, hostname and optionally the port in the URI syntax (i.e. https://api.example.com:8080). Can be overridden in endpoint configuration.

camel.component.rest-openapi.autowiredEn.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.rest-openapi.autowiredEn.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.rest-openapi.sslContextP.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.sslContextParameters
camel.component.rest-openapi.sslContextP.description: Customize TLS parameters used by the component. If not set defaults to the TLS parameters set in the Camel context

camel.component.rest-openapi.useGlobalSs.name: camel.component.rest-openapi.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.rest-openapi.useGlobalSs.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
